alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 26 at 4:11PM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Wisconsin... Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Grant, Clayton, Allamakee and Crawford Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at McGregor. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, The road near the casino in Marquette is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 22.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM CDT Wednesday was 22.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.5 feet Friday. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.8 feet on 04/20/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued tonight by 11 PM CDT.
